title: Octavian (later known as Augustus) enters Alexandria, Egypt, bringing it under the control of the Roman Republic.
text: Octavian (later known as Augustus) enters Alexandria, Egypt, bringing it under the control of the Roman Republic.

title: Batavian rebellion: The Batavians in Germania Inferior (Netherlands) revolt under the leadership of Gaius Julius Civilis.
text: Batavian rebellion: The Batavians in Germania Inferior (Netherlands) revolt under the leadership of Gaius Julius Civilis.

title: Justinian I becomes the sole ruler of the Byzantine Empire.
text: Justinian I becomes the sole ruler of the Byzantine Empire.

title: Ono no Imoko is dispatched as envoy to the Sui court in China (Traditional Japanese date: July 3, 607).
text: Ono no Imoko is dispatched as envoy to the Sui court in China (Traditional Japanese date: July 3, 607).

title: Taormina, the last Byzantine stronghold in Sicily, is captured by the Aghlabids army, concluding the Muslim conquest of Sicily.
text: Taormina, the last Byzantine stronghold in Sicily, is captured by the Aghlabids army, concluding the Muslim conquest of Sicily.

title: Isaac II Angelos, restored Eastern Roman Emperor, declares his son Alexios IV Angelos co-emperor after pressure from the forces of the Fourth Crusade.
text: Isaac II Angelos, restored Eastern Roman Emperor, declares his son Alexios IV Angelos co-emperor after pressure from the forces of the Fourth Crusade.

title: The Old Swiss Confederacy is formed with the signature of the Federal Charter.
text: The Old Swiss Confederacy is formed with the signature of the Federal Charter.

title: Louis XI of France founds the chivalric order called the Order of Saint Michael in Amboise.
text: Louis XI of France founds the chivalric order called the Order of Saint Michael in Amboise.

title: Christopher Columbus becomes the first European to visit what is now Venezuela.
text: Christopher Columbus becomes the first European to visit what is now Venezuela.

title: The Ottoman conquest of Cyprus is concluded, by the surrender of Famagusta.
text: The Ottoman conquest of Cyprus is concluded, by the surrender of Famagusta.

title: Speedwell leaves Delfshaven to bring pilgrims to America by way of England.
text: Speedwell leaves Delfshaven to bring pilgrims to America by way of England.

title: Ottoman forces are defeated in the battle of Saint Gotthard by an Austrian army led by Raimondo Montecuccoli, resulting in the Peace of Vasvár.
text: Ottoman forces are defeated in the battle of Saint Gotthard by an Austrian army led by Raimondo Montecuccoli, resulting in the Peace of Vasvár.

title: George, Elector of Hanover, becomes King George I of Great Britain, marking the beginning of the Georgian era of British history.
text: George, Elector of Hanover, becomes King George I of Great Britain, marking the beginning of the Georgian era of British history.

title: Seven Years' War: The Battle of Minden, an allied Anglo-German army victory over the French. In Britain this was one of a number of events that constituted the Annus Mirabilis of 1759 and is celebrated as Minden Day by certain British Army regiments.
text: Seven Years' War: The Battle of Minden, an allied Anglo-German army victory over the French. In Britain this was one of a number of events that constituted the Annus Mirabilis of 1759 and is celebrated as Minden Day by certain British Army regiments.

title: British scientist Joseph Priestley discovers oxygen gas, corroborating the prior discovery of this element by German-Swedish chemist Carl Wilhelm Scheele.
text: British scientist Joseph Priestley discovers oxygen gas, corroborating the prior discovery of this element by German-Swedish chemist Carl Wilhelm Scheele.

title: French Revolutionary Wars: Battle of the Nile (Battle of Aboukir Bay): Battle begins when a British fleet engages the French Revolutionary Navy fleet in an unusual night action.
text: French Revolutionary Wars: Battle of the Nile (Battle of Aboukir Bay): Battle begins when a British fleet engages the French Revolutionary Navy fleet in an unusual night action.

title: The Acts of Union 1800 are passed which merge the Kingdom of Great Britain and the Kingdom of Ireland into the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland.
text: The Acts of Union 1800 are passed which merge the Kingdom of Great Britain and the Kingdom of Ireland into the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland.

title: First Barbary War: The American schooner USS Enterprise captures the Tripolitan polacca Tripoli in a single-ship action off the coast of modern-day Libya.
text: First Barbary War: The American schooner USS Enterprise captures the Tripolitan polacca Tripoli in a single-ship action off the coast of modern-day Libya.

title: Slavery is abolished in the British Empire as the Slavery Abolition Act 1833 comes into force.
text: Slavery is abolished in the British Empire as the Slavery Abolition Act 1833 comes into force.

title: The Lombard Street riot erupts in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, United States.
text: The Lombard Street riot erupts in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, United States.

title: The first ascent of Monte Rosa, the second highest summit in the Alps.
text: The first ascent of Monte Rosa, the second highest summit in the Alps.

title: Colorado is admitted as the 38th U.S. state.
text: Colorado is admitted as the 38th U.S. state.

title: Henry Perky patents shredded wheat.
text: Henry Perky patents shredded wheat.

title: The First Sino-Japanese War erupts between Japan and China over Korea.
text: The First Sino-Japanese War erupts between Japan and China over Korea.

title: The start of the first Scout camp on Brownsea Island, the origin of the worldwide Scouting movement.
text: The start of the first Scout camp on Brownsea Island, the origin of the worldwide Scouting movement.

title: Harriet Quimby takes her pilot's test and becomes the first U.S. woman to earn an Aero Club of America aviator's certificate.
text: Harriet Quimby takes her pilot's test and becomes the first U.S. woman to earn an Aero Club of America aviator's certificate.

title: The German Empire declares war on the Russian Empire at the opening of World War I. The Swiss Army mobilizes because of World War I.
text: The German Empire declares war on the Russian Empire at the opening of World War I. The Swiss Army mobilizes because of World War I.

title: The Nanchang Uprising marks the first significant battle in the Chinese Civil War between the Kuomintang and Chinese Communist Party. This day is commemorated as the anniversary of the founding of the People's Liberation Army.
text: The Nanchang Uprising marks the first significant battle in the Chinese Civil War between the Kuomintang and Chinese Communist Party. This day is commemorated as the anniversary of the founding of the People's Liberation Army.

title: Anti-Fascist activists Bruno Tesch, Walter Möller, Karl Wolff and August Lütgens executed by the Nazi regime in Altona.
text: Anti-Fascist activists Bruno Tesch, Walter Möller, Karl Wolff and August Lütgens executed by the Nazi regime in Altona.

title: The Olympics opened in Berlin with a ceremony presided over by Adolf Hitler.
text: The Olympics opened in Berlin with a ceremony presided over by Adolf Hitler.

title: Josip Broz Tito reads the resolution "Manifesto of constitutional congress of KPH" to the constitutive congress of KPH (Croatian Communist Party) in woods near Samobor.
text: Josip Broz Tito reads the resolution "Manifesto of constitutional congress of KPH" to the constitutive congress of KPH (Croatian Communist Party) in woods near Samobor.

title: World War II: Operation Tidal Wave also known as "Black Sunday", was a failed American attempt to destroy Romanian oil fields.
text: World War II: Operation Tidal Wave also known as "Black Sunday", was a failed American attempt to destroy Romanian oil fields.

title: World War II: The Warsaw Uprising against the Nazi German occupation breaks out in Warsaw, Poland.
text: World War II: The Warsaw Uprising against the Nazi German occupation breaks out in Warsaw, Poland.

title: Leaders of the Russian Liberation Army, a force of Russian prisoners of war that collaborated with Nazi Germany, are executed in Moscow, Soviet Union for treason.
text: Leaders of the Russian Liberation Army, a force of Russian prisoners of war that collaborated with Nazi Germany, are executed in Moscow, Soviet Union for treason.

title: The United States and Canada form the North American Aerospace Defense Command (NORAD).
text: The United States and Canada form the North American Aerospace Defense Command (NORAD).

title: Dahomey (later renamed Benin) declares independence from France.
text: Dahomey (later renamed Benin) declares independence from France.

title: Islamabad is declared the federal capital of the Government of Pakistan.
text: Islamabad is declared the federal capital of the Government of Pakistan.

title: U.S. Defense Secretary Robert McNamara orders the creation of the Defense Intelligence Agency (DIA), the nation's first centralized military espionage organization.
text: U.S. Defense Secretary Robert McNamara orders the creation of the Defense Intelligence Agency (DIA), the nation's first centralized military espionage organization.

title: The former Belgian Congo is renamed the Democratic Republic of the Congo.
text: The former Belgian Congo is renamed the Democratic Republic of the Congo.

title: Charles Whitman kills 16 people at the University of Texas at Austin before being killed by the police.
text: Charles Whitman kills 16 people at the University of Texas at Austin before being killed by the police.

title: Purges of intellectuals and imperialists becomes official China policy at the beginning of the Cultural Revolution.
text: Purges of intellectuals and imperialists becomes official China policy at the beginning of the Cultural Revolution.

title: The coronation is held of Hassanal Bolkiah, the 29th Sultan of Brunei.
text: The coronation is held of Hassanal Bolkiah, the 29th Sultan of Brunei.

title: The Concert for Bangladesh, organized by former Beatle George Harrison, is held at Madison Square Garden in New York City.
text: The Concert for Bangladesh, organized by former Beatle George Harrison, is held at Madison Square Garden in New York City.

title: Cyprus dispute: The United Nations Security Council authorizes the UNFICYP to create the "Green Line", dividing Cyprus into two zones.
text: Cyprus dispute: The United Nations Security Council authorizes the UNFICYP to create the "Green Line", dividing Cyprus into two zones.

title: Vigdís Finnbogadóttir is elected President of Iceland and becomes the world's first democratically elected female head of state.
text: Vigdís Finnbogadóttir is elected President of Iceland and becomes the world's first democratically elected female head of state.

title: A train crash kills 18 people in County Cork, Ireland.
text: A train crash kills 18 people in County Cork, Ireland.

title: MTV begins broadcasting in the United States and airs its first video, "Video Killed the Radio Star" by The Buggles.
text: MTV begins broadcasting in the United States and airs its first video, "Video Killed the Radio Star" by The Buggles.

title: Commercial peat-cutters discover the preserved bog body of a man, called Lindow Man, at Lindow Moss, Cheshire, England.
text: Commercial peat-cutters discover the preserved bog body of a man, called Lindow Man, at Lindow Moss, Cheshire, England.

title: A British soldier was killed in the Inglis Barracks bombing in London, England.[1]
text: A British soldier was killed in the Inglis Barracks bombing in London, England.[1]

title: The Great Mississippi and Missouri Rivers Flood of 1993 comes to a peak.
text: The Great Mississippi and Missouri Rivers Flood of 1993 comes to a peak.

title: A supermarket fire kills 396 people and injures 500 others in Asunción, Paraguay.
text: A supermarket fire kills 396 people and injures 500 others in Asunción, Paraguay.

title: The I-35W Mississippi River bridge spanning the Mississippi River in Minneapolis, Minnesota, collapses during the evening rush hour.
text: The I-35W Mississippi River bridge spanning the Mississippi River in Minneapolis, Minnesota, collapses during the evening rush hour.

title: The Beijing–Tianjin Intercity Railway begins operation as the fastest commuter rail system in the world.
text: The Beijing–Tianjin Intercity Railway begins operation as the fastest commuter rail system in the world.

title: Eleven mountaineers from international expeditions died on K2, the second-highest mountain on Earth in the worst single accident in the history of K2 mountaineering.

title: A suicide attack on a mosque in Heart, Afghanistan kills 20 people.
